entry.title: Outbound connections rotation
entry.summary: In an email exchange on August 18, 2014, Ivan Pustogarov explained how Bitcoin peers keep a history of addresses that are forwarded to their neighbors. The purpose of this is to prevent the retransmission of an address that has already been forwarded to a neighbor. However, it seems that there was some confusion in the conversation and Pustogarov apologized for any misunderstandings.
